4th Grade Service Project
Ms. Jacobson, Mrs. White and their classes cooperated with an organization called Adopt-A-Soldier, based out of Peotone, to decorate boxes to be sent overseas. The organization sent the classes boxes for the students to decorate patriotically. The organization will then pack the boxes with goods to send to the soldiers. The class also wrote cards to be put in the boxes and sent to soldiers. The class then had a speaker, come in to speak to the students about what it is like to be in the military. He served in the Army and received care packages so he talked to the students about how much care packages mean to the soldiers that receive them. The students enjoyed listening to him talk about his experience and learned just how important sending and decorating the care packages can be to the soldiers.

It is the administration and staff's hope that our students will again take an active role in feeding the many hungry families this holiday season through our food drive.
Thank you in advance for supporting the less fortunate in our community.

post_text: What a great day at GPES. It's exciting to have teachers who think outside the box to get students excited about learning! 5th graders wrote persuasive essays to teachers of thier choice to convince them why it would be a good idea for them to eat a cricket. We held an all school assembly so the kids could see which teachers were persuaded and "Brave" enough to actually eat a cricket. The following are pictures of staff who were persuaded and actually ate a cricket to the crowd chanting, "Eat It, Eat It!" Mrs. Sproul, Mrs. Sluis, Mr.Thompson, Ms. Planeta, Mrs. Dumas, Mr.Joe, Ms. Siebert, and Mrs. Gore. Mrs. Lehman tried to turn the tables on her student and persuade her to eat the cricket but in the end neither one did. We even challenge a couple of 5th graders, which didn't quite get them all the way down to thier stomachs.
